name: UIPageControl
desc: A control that displays a horizontal series of dots, each of which corresponds to a page in the app’s document or other data-model entity.

items.name: var currentPage: Int
items.desc: The current page, shown by the receiver as a white dot.

items.name: var numberOfPages: Int
items.desc: The number of pages the receiver shows (as dots).

items.name: var hidesForSinglePage: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that controls whether the page control is hidden when there is only one page.

items.name: var pageIndicatorTintColor: UIColor?
items.desc: The tint color to be used for the page indicator.

items.name: var currentPageIndicatorTintColor: UIColor?
items.desc: The tint color to be used for the current page indicator.

items.name: func size(forNumberOfPages: Int) -> CGSize
items.desc: Returns the size the receiver’s bounds should be to accommodate the given number of pages.

items.name: enum UIPageControl.BackgroundStyle
items.desc: Constants that define the background styles of the page control.

items.name: var allowsContinuousInteraction: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that determines whether the page control allows continuous interaction.

items.name: var interactionState: UIPageControl.InteractionState
items.desc: The interaction state when the current page changes.

items.name: enum UIPageControl.InteractionState
items.desc: Constants that define the interaction states of the page control.

items.name: func setIndicatorImage(UIImage?, forPage: Int)
items.desc: Sets the indicator image for the specified page.

items.name: func indicatorImage(forPage: Int) -> UIImage?
items.desc: Retrieves the indicator image for the specified page.
